intro: Manulea androsacea, commonly known as the Androsace manulea, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
